Statement 1| The training error of 1-nearest neighbor classifier is 0. Statement 2| As the number of data points grows to infinity, the MAP estimate approaches the MLE estimate for all possible priors. In other words, given enough data, the choice of prior is irrelevant. A. True, True, B. False, False, C. True, False, D. False, True

The correct answer: C. True, False.

Explanation:
- Statement 1 is True. The 1-nearest neighbor classifier will always have a training error of 0 because it memorizes the training data.
- Statement 2 is False. Even as the number of data points grows to infinity, the MAP (Maximum A Posteriori) estimate does not necessarily approach the MLE (Maximum Likelihood Estimate) for all possible priors. The choice of prior can still be relevant depending on the prior distribution and the data.

Which of the following are valid intervals of convergence for a power series?
(I) [−1, 3)
(II) (−∞, 0]
(III) [2, 2] ∪ [3, 3]
(IV) (−∞,∞) A. Only (II), B. Only (IV ), C. (I) and (IV ), D. (II) and (III)

The correct answer: C. (I) and (IV)

Intervals of convergence for power series can be open, closed, or half-open intervals, as well as the entire real line or a single point. However, they must be a single interval, not a union of disjoint intervals.

- Interval (I) [−1, 3) is valid because it is a half-open interval.
- Interval (II) (−∞, 0] is not valid because the radius of convergence would be infinite, which only makes sense if the interval is the entire real line.
